paragraphs.text: Anxious Britain will find no succour in a TV election debate.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: The prospect of the television election debates elicits from me two incompatible responses
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: On the one hand, I believe strongly that the Greens should be invited
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it's on the basis of having a seat in the house
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: , then
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they have the same right as Ukip
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it's on the grounds of polling
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: they have a stronger claim than the Liberal Democrats
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it's on the basis of who Ofcom thinks is a good chap
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: then
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Ofcom needs to have a word with itself
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I have mild views on how much of a psephological impact the debates have in the first place (some), and whether it constitutes a democratic deficit not to have them(no)
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: On the other hand
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I know how these debates will unfold, if indeed they do: much like a mud wrestle, without the energy, or any prospect of a winner
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This election has already turned "debate" into a series of "dids!" and"didn'ts!"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "You caused the crash."
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: "Didn't."
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: "Did."
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: "We reduced the deficit."
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: "Didn't."
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: "Did."
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: It is beneath them to perform it, and certainly beneath us all to watch
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Once, finding nothing attractive forthcoming in the political offering, we could turn away to apathy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That was the boom-time option
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The idea that politicians are identical, and all we've got, once induced a comfortable stupor: now it feels like an anxiety dream
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Something's Not Right
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Insecurity and an Anxious Nation is a report published today by Compass as an overview of the economic situation in which most people find themselves
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Its author, Michael Orton, describes a 20-75-5 nation: there'
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: s an intractable fifth of people in poverty, and an unaffected elite numbering approximately 5%
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: which has held since the 1990s
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The difference is that vast space in between, three-quarters of people, who are now beset by named and nameless fears
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: There are concrete worries about debt, wages, childcare, food, energy and the impossibility of ever being a homeowner, or the inevitability of rent increases for the tenant with no options
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: To all this is added less measurable, longer-term anxieties: that workplace security is getting weaker, that whatever is bad now will be worse for the next generation; that the new scale of indebtedness, gargantuan mortgages for those who can get them, student debts running to billions, will result in a new kind of servitude - but to whom?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The problem with the status quo, an anti-corporate campaigner said to me once, is that it's not static
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It's getting worse
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Not one of these fears could ever be called unreasonable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the numbers are in
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: We are clear that real median hourly wages have gone down by 10.2 percent and are now lower than they were in 1997
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: People on average incomes are at a greater danger of falling into debt than the unemployed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We are now pursuing what Orton calls "a high living cost, low income, high debt, low savings approach"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: It's rather tactful to call this an "approach"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "Hurtling off a cliff" would work just as well
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The prevalence of anxiety as a condition of modern life is undisputed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: according to the Office of National Statistics, 20% of people rate their level of anxiety as six or more out of 10, at any one time
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: As many as one in three will suffer from panic attacks at some point in their life
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: The suggested solutions are usually a triangulation of exercise, drugs and cognitive behavioural therapy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In England last year, 40m prescriptions were issued for antidepressants
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: (which includes anti-anxiety drugs)
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: CBT and exercise have their disciples, but clearly aren't panaceas
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There is no shortage of people - psychologists, sociologists, doctors - looking beyond the frailties of the human mind for wider causes
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is commonplace to cite consumerism and its attendant evils of working too hard to fund it, and missing the things that are important, while you work
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: - and yet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: however social the problem, the suggested solutions are always individual
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Stop wanting things
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: stop spending
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: prioritise
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: downsize
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: take stock
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You can't control the world
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: so try controlling your negative response to it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is also commonplace, T-shirt-sloganly common, to say that to be anxious is nothing more than a rational response to precarious conditions
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: what will it take for us to build that into a set of political demands, rather than try to interrogate them away with introspection and positive self-talk?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: At the start of a panic attack, you are supposed to commence the catechism: what am I afraid of?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: How likely is it to happen?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Can I do anything to prevent its happening?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This questionnaire was devised as a balm
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: what if the answers are "I'm afraid that life will continue to be as hard as it is right now, for my entire life, and be worse for my children."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "I'm afraid this is extremely likely."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "I could do everything about it; just not on my own."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What then?
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Will the leadership debates take on a new piquancy
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: when politics suddenly looks like the only answer?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Norman Tebbit told the Observer that we were going into the "most awful election campaign that anyone can remember"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: His answer was bread and circuses
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "The public enjoy confrontations," he said
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: It's so wrong, it's intoxicating
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We have taken confrontation, and sometimes enjoyed it, in lieu of a politics that has anything to say about lives as they are mostly lived
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But it's gone on long enough
paragraphs.label: assumption
